content.description: On the west face of the Pocket Wall, this problem climbs the licheny slab past a small bulge.

A interesting and tricky traverse which begins below and right of Northwest Pockets, climbing across the base of the wall and finishes up the North Seam.  Start on Jugs on the NW rounded arete (between the West slab route - Slabbing Westward - V3 - to the right and NW Pockets to the left) and work out tricky moves just above the dirt and rocks across the base of the wall to the North Seam. Keep it together and crank up the N Seam to finish.
content.protection: For the North Seam exit a small rock and sloped landing make for some tricky spotting and if the climber should fall, pad and spot recommended.

content.description: Kinda highball and committing, the crux of this problem is getting established on the good holds in the little dihedral near the top.
content.protection: Two or more pads is ideal, as well as a spot.
content.location: On the arete right of the seam route on the Pocket Wall. Start with the left hand in the obvious, deep pocket and head for the dihedral above

content.description: The distinctive seam on the left side of the wall is clean, classic and fun.  Layback, highstep and otherwise ascend the seam. Positive hands, balancy moves and delicate footwork are indicative of the line. A must do.
content.protection: A small rock and sloped landing make for some tricky spotting and if the climber should fall, pad and spot recommended.
